com.zrd.rtp.model.measurements

Class Measurement

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zrd.rtp.model.measurements.Measurement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Measurement>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Distance, Duration, Velocity

    public abstract class Measurement
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Measurement>
    This is an abstract class representing a single measurement.
    Author:
    Zach DeStefano

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Measurement add(Measurement val)
      This will add the current measurement to the one passed in and return the result as a third measurement.
      int compareTo(Measurement o)
      This compares measurements together by finding the difference between the values.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      This sees if two values are equal by seeing if compareTo results in 0.
      abstract java.lang.String getImperialText()
      This returns the text in the default imperial unit
      abstract java.lang.String getMetricText()
      This returns the text in the default metric unit
      int getRoundedValue()
      Does the same as getValue() except it is rounded to the nearest integer
      double getValue()
      This gets the measurement value as a double
      Measurement subtract(Measurement val)
      This will subtract the passed in measurement from the current measurement and return the result as a third measurement.
      java.lang.String toString()
      This finds the default locale and if it is US, then it calls getImperialText().

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Measurement o)
        This compares measurements together by finding the difference between the values. If the difference is between -1 and 1, they are considered equal.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Measurement>

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        This sees if two values are equal by seeing if compareTo results in 0. For information on that logic, look at compareTo.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This finds the default locale and if it is US, then it calls getImperialText(). Otherwise, it calls getMetricText().
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
